Key Match Events: Giancarlo Stanton hit a solo home run in the eighth inning to give the Yankees a 3-2 lead over the Royals.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone admired Stanton's focus and mental game in big moments.
Giancarlo Stanton stated, 'This is what I came here for,' referring to his postseason success.
The Yankees bullpen continued its strong performance by tossing 4 1/3 shutout innings in relief of Clarke Schmidt.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Stanton stole a base earlier in the game, which cost the Yankees multiple scoring chances earlier in the series.
The Royals tied the game in the fifth inning with an infield single, double, and triple.
The Yankees struggled with runners in scoring position, going 0-for-6 to make it 3-for-25 in the series.
The game was tied 2-2 after five innings before Stanton's home run in the eighth inning.
